name: Sean J
text:
Scammers. They did not perform the services they said they were going to. They completely ignored the proper protocol for mold removal and had to be let go mid service. They piled mold contaminated items on top of non contaminated items. They did not seal off contaminated rooms from other areas.
They took advantage of my elderly in-laws.
Would give no stars if possible.

In response to your response. The proper protocol plan that you told my wife you were going to follow was not followed. You set bags of contaminated items on our personal items in a separate room. You stacked contaminated bags against the face of a flatscreen tv. There were pieces of contaminated sheetrock all over the floor in a room that you claimed was clean. Yes, I was upset because of all of this.
As my wife explained to you in the beginning,  she is highly allergic to mold. So, when I saw contaminated items drug through our living room and placed on our non contaminated things, it upset me. I even took pictures of it. I'm sorry your feelings got hurt, but you ruined our things and wasted our time.

We have now discovered that more things were ruined in the bags they carelessly packed. A bottle of shampoo was thrown into a bag where it broke open and poured onto my daughter's $300 camera, the bible she received from us at her Baptism, and many other valuables. That was just one bag. The amount of loss from this company is beyond a money value. Personal, irreplaceable  items were destroyed also.

In response to what you responded to my wife and her comments. All I can say is that you're shameless. We know the difference between  what you said that you would do and what was done...two completely different things. Again, to anyone who reads this...no stars.

resp.text: Sean, Your review is not true or accurate.  Our company followed appropriate protocol which included erecting containment barriers.  There was NO cross-contamination, as you stated.  Our company has been in business since 1979 and we are highly reputable.  All was running smoothly until you entered the picture. What you failed to mention was your erratic behavior towards our crew.  You verbally assaulted our crew and even continued yelling after our crew had exited the house.  You displayed a total lack of self control.  We did not create the mold issues in this house but we are well qualified to remediate any mold problem.  It appears that your personal problems boiled over and you chose to take it out on our crew.  That was a cowardly move.  For clarification- While your in-laws are senior citizens, your description of them as "elderly" invokes an image of feebleness.  Your in-laws appear to be spry, able bodied and mentally fit.  Furthermore, your assertion that we were taking advantage of your in-laws may well be a projection since you - a grown man, are living in your in-laws basement. Your behavior and attempts to discredit our company are/were immature and reprehensible!

name: Paige Janke
text:
LIARS, SCAMMERS & THIEVES!!!!

This review is in addition to the one my husband, Sean, left last week. I met with Rick and his wife at the beginning of August for them to run air sample tests on my parents house. They ran the test in 4 rooms, and called me 2 days later with the results.  When Rick called me he said that the levels of Stachybotrys were among some of the highest indoor levels he had seen in his 15 years of experience. In addition to the phone call I received an email from him with the results and a message stating that it was very dangerous for anyone to enter that area without protective gear on. He also insisted that we allow them to come back out and test 2 more rooms in the same area. He and his wife came back the next day, August 11th or 12th, to run the other 2 tests. WE STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED THE RESULTS FROM THOSE TESTS THAT WE PAID FOR 2 MONTHS AGO. We have asked for the results multiple times and the only answer my Dad got was that the tests came back ok.

Before Paragon Industrial was hired to do the mold remediation, I spoke with Rick and his wife about their protocol for removing contaminated items as to not cross contaminate the other rooms and items. After talking with them at length about how they would do the job, I felt comfortable with the protocol and encouraged my 80 year old father to go with their company.

They told my parents that they needed to run the air scrubbers upstairs and clean the air ducts first. Why would you clean upstairs before you remediate the toxic black mold downstairs? That doesn't even make sense. The mold should have been remediated first, then the air ducts, and last the air scrubbers.

When they came to start the remediation THEY DID NOT FOLLOW ANY OF THE PROTOCOLS THAT THEY HAD EXPLAINED TO ME IN DETAIL BEFORE BEING HIRED! As far as erecting containment barriers, they put up some plastic sheeting with duck tape that began peeling off of the walls and door the same day they were put up. The air conditioning vents were not sealed off and the unit was not shut off while they were ripping moldy Sheetrock down. Also, they threw everything into black garbage bags from the contaminated room and threw it on top of our furniture in the living room causing CROSS CONTAMINATION. There was also moldy Sheetrock strewn down the hall where they drug it out! They explained to me that the Sheetrock would be taken down in small pieces, bagged and sealed before being removed completely from the house.

My ELDERLY father called to tell us what was going on at the house and I told my husband to go make sure things were being done like they said they were going to do them. When my husband, Sean, got to the house he found a huge mess! EVERYTHING HAD BEEN CROSS CONTAMINATED! My husband was in shock at how careless they were being because he was concerned about the impact it would have on my health! We had recently found out that I have lesions on my spine, unusual rashes, peripheral neuropathy, daily debilitating migraines, and chronic sinus infections ALL caused by exposure to black mold. My husband had to leave me alone in bed after being released from the hospital to come over to the house to find out what was going on. That is the reason he reacted the way he did, because he is genuinely concerned about the health of his wife! Any man who saw someone doing something that would bring harm to his family would react the same way!

My father called Rick and released him from the job the next day. He was supposed to return some of the money that my dad had paid upfront, but of course that has not been returned. My parents paid out almost $4000 for them to make a grand mess out of everything!

Since then my parents have had a professional air conditioning company come check the air ducts upstairs that were supposed to be cleaned for $900 and he showed them that they had only been wiped out a couple feet. He inquired about what was paid, and couldn't believe that they paid for the service!!!

I would keep going if google would allow me more characters.

resp.text:
Like your husband, your recollection of events is inaccurate.
The work upstairs was a completely different Indoor Air Quality Issue.  The work upstairs was not mold related.  Because your parents were living in this area, it was the priority.
The work downstairs was performed using industry protocol.
I would like to remind you that we did not cause your mold problem and we did not cause your illness and health problems.
Please stop making false accusations against our company. I wish you the best with your family and your health.

text:

July 5, and on Sunday July 4th at 6pm she called to tell me she didn't have a car and could not get a rental in time. I was offered for a reschedule but my company was coming July 4 that evening. Hello Donna, We are so very sorry that your cleaner was unable to service your home. As you know, she was in an auto accident, and unfortunately was unable to service your home as scheduled. Being the 4th of July holiday, we were completely booked and unable to send a replacement. We'd hoped you would be open to rescheduling the following business day, but understand that your service was time sensitive. Thank you for the opportunity and we hope you know how sorry we are that you did not receive the service you'd been anticipating and looking forward to having.

The Maids a la Mode Team

Ms. Key– As discussed, we did not renew your 30-day contract as Customer Service support because you did not meet the basic skills required to work with our company. Discourtesy and lack of professionalism in dealing with our valued Customers, basic spelling, grammar and written communication deficiencies, and the inability to follow clear, written instructions led to our decision not to renew your contract.

In order to honor our Agreement with you, we paid your fee in full through the end of your contract. But, in light of your professional shortcomings and deficiencies, we could not in good faith renew your contract or expend the additional company resources required to teach you the fundamentals we were under the impression you already possessed, per your resume.

We understand that after having been unable to secure work for one year prior to this, you had hoped this might be a longer-term engagement. After 60 hours of paid orientation and the considerable company resources allocated, we'd hoped for a longer-term engagement as well. Unfortunately, we simply do not have confidence in your ability to interact with and be of service to our valued Customers at this time.

name: Savannah Stanley
text: Hello. I just got a comment under a post I wrote a review for FOUR YEARS AGO. I do not and have never worked for this company. Administration wrote under my comment that I was a previous employee? I was a customer and left a bad review and that was there cover up. I was affiliated with the company being a CUSTOMER not EMPLOYEE. If you own/manage the business and see this id like you to know that when you write a comment under a review get your facts straight. Have a great day! 🙂

resp.text:
Hello, Savannah. Our sincere apologies for any confusion. We really would like to clear this up with you. Our policy is to follow up with each and every one of our clients after every appointment to make sure that they are happy with their service. This is an important part of how we maintain excellent relationships with our clients and resolve any issues that may arise. However, when we first read your 1-star review, we attempted to reach out to you to see what had gone wrong so that we could fix it for you. But upon looking into our CRM system, we found no record at all of ever having performed service for a "Savannah Stanley". Perhaps, you booked your service under a different name? We did, however, have a Savannah S. who had recently stopped working with us, which is why we reached the conclusion we did.

Although 4 years have passed, we would sincerely like to know how we could have improved your experience and would love the opportunity to make you a happy customer moving forward. The owner, Kirsten Rand, can be reached at our Mobile office if you would like to speak with her personally. Thank you and have a wonderful day.

name: Nathan King
text:
On move-in day at our new house, we had another cleaning company scheduled, and they never showed. I called Two Maids & A Mop and asked if there was any way they could squeeze us in (this is a few hours before the end of the business day on a Friday, mind you). They ensured they could get us something, and within two hours, two cleaners were at our door.

Not only that, but our AC went out in the middle of the clean (it was 98 degrees outside). The cleaners just laughed it off and were incredibly professional and friendly. They even offered us some advice on cleaning certain areas of our new house in the future.

I recommend TM&AM to anyone needing cleaning services in the Auburn area. They are extremely dedicated to providing a quality product and good service. They were excellent in helping us with a situation that could have been a mess — literally and figuratively.

name: 廖本庭
text:
Be careful with your belongings...

Booked moving clean online. Last minute notice for changing time due to they don't go through that route the scheduled day. After cleaning was done, all of the blinds were not cleaned as advertised. Had to ask them to come back. When I went back to check again, the frame for the vent outlet was on the floor.... Worst of all, they threw away a large area rug after first cleaning instead of cleaning it as advertised on the website. Called to talk to customer service about the area rug and was told she wasn't authorized to handle this and will ask the owner to contact me. Nothing happened after a week. My wife called again and was told the same thing. Never was contacted. Paid more to get the service quality and hassle free  but it wasn't there.

resp.text:
Thanks for your feedback.  We are certainly not perfect but implying we would take or knowingly dispose of someone's belongings is baseless and says more about your character than ours....

Let's be clear, you left your rug with other items for our team to remove from home post move out.  Your attempt to imply otherwise unfair and not accurate.

Move in  / Move out is for empty homes.  Deep cleans are for homes where items remain.

As discussed several times, typically  in a move in / move out clean the expectation is the house will be empty.  We are glad to place a small amount of trash that remains in the garbage as a service.    In your case, you left some miscellaneous items as well as this rug.     As we explained, if there were items that were not to be disposed of, you needed to provided guidance prior to our team arriving and cleaning the home.

Do believe our team went back to home to address an item you discussed with our manager.   We try extremely hard to stay on schedule but some times events occur outside our control.  Not an excuse just the reality.

End of the day we certainly don't like having dissatisfied customers but are willing to take the negative feedback rather than pay for a rug that was left with other items to be disposed of after move out.  Had we been provided this direction prior to arriving at home we would be more than glad to address.    Thanks for your business and my apologies your are dissatisfied with your experience.  Sometimes we simply cannot find a solution that is fair to both parties based how event transpire.

name: Naomi Rigby
text:
First - let me say - I have VERY high expectations when paying someone to clean my house...
Now, let me say...
I WOULD recommend Two Maids and a Mop (Auburn) - only because of Whitney and Melissa!!!
Two weeks ago - yesterday, Two Maids and a Mop (Auburn) came to my house for a thorough cleaning.  After leaving, unfortunately, I was unimpressed, but because we all have "bad days", my first instinct was to give them another chance.
The day of my follow-up cleaning (2 weeks later), I sent a text to confirm my appt time - since I did not receive a text reminder - like I did for the initial cleaning.  After a short time had past, with no reply, I called and spoke to Chrissy.  Although I did not call to complain, I did mention that I was not satisfied with my first cleaning - and why, but explained that - because everyone has bad days - I was waiting for this cleaning to see how things went.  I must say, once on the phone, Chrissy was very responsive and willing to make everything right.
Now to the GOOD stuff...  Whitney and Melissa.  These 2 ladies are THE BOMB!  They came in - WORKED HARD, and had my house "sparkling" when they left - so much so - that upon their departure, I immediately sent  Chrissy another text message - PRAISING their work and asking to have these 2 young ladies clean my house from now on.  (Sadly - I am still awaiting a response.)
It is women like Whitney and Melissa who make a business look - not just good - but impeccable!!!! - and all the bad bearable.  (Two Maids and a Mop - Auburn needs to do all they can do to keep these 2 ladies happy and working for them!)
I sincerely hope I hear back from Chrissy soon - saying - yes to my request. 😀

name: Shannon Anway
text: I was never informed the deep cleaning would cost $400 dollars, but was charged $400. To clarify, when I entered the information online I was given the price of $140 dollars. I THEN spoke with a representative of the company who clarified the first clean would be a deep clean, but never stated this would result in a higher cost. I was completely misled to believe my fee would be the $140 versus almost $400. When I called to discuss they could not give me a rational for why the price was as expensive as it was and accused me of lying on the internet submission regarding occupancy and square footage even though I told the woman I spoke to on the phone I lived with my boyfriend and two dogs. Completely unprofessional, dishonest and clearly have poor business ethics. Additionally, when I informed them I’ve used cleaning services for a number of years and have never been charged that much for an initial clean (and told them the name of the company I had used in my previous rental), they eluded to the fact that the company in question was not professional or a legitimate business. Who speaks of competitors that way? Would never recommend and would give zero stars if possible.

resp.text:
Shannon thanks for your feedback.  As I understand you booked your clean online.  There is some expectation that folks who enter data requested for booking online will provided accurate data.  When booking online you indicated you had 0 pets, 1 occupant, and your square footage was 2200.   My understanding is you have 2 occupants and 2 pets per your phone conversation.    Your clean was actually discounted based on less occupants and no pets.

My understanding is you had no issues with the service other than price.  Hard to address what you heard or did not hear during the call with our office as it relates to price.  We certainly try to communicate price as part of any booking but your reaction indicates you did not hear it or we failed to communicate it.

Lastly, based on your call your position was discount or negative reviews.  Unfortunately we do run into this situation 1 or 2 times per year.   Certainly don't like failing to meet your expectations, but will not be coerced into discounts by threats either.  You bear some responsibility to understand the services you have secured. This would certainly be an exception for one of our customers to invite us into their home to clean and not know what services they will receive and what they will cost.

Any desire to discuss further just call the office and let Chrissy know you want to chat with the owner and she will put us in touch.

name: Deborah Jackson
text: The management is the problem. To get your business they claim they will be glad to work in your choices of appointments. But then you are at the mercy of someone sitting at the computer and letting it generate times and days. Your schedule doesn’t matter. Poor service model. They think you work for them. Some type of issue with the manager and her ability to follow directions. You cannot substitute their services either. I make my own beds, take trash out and pick up house in advance thinking other items could get done in place of those chores. Nope, anything but what is listed is extra. Not sure though how they do ceiling fans on the list because once you hire them, they refuse to get on a step stool. Price point is higher than other competitors.

resp.text:
Deborah I am sorry that your experience has led you to feel this way.  I can certainly appreciate your comment around being at the mercy of someone at a computer screen.

The Team has cleaned your home two previous times without comment or criticism.   In fact, after your Thanksgiving clean you texted “the girls did a really good job”.

Today you turned our team away and were charged a cancellation fee.  These type fees are always a tough decision as a business owner.   You know a negative review might be coming because you stuck by your cancellation policy.  In most cases it is the right thing to do for the PHC's whose earnings will be impacted by the late cancellation. For 99% of customers this simply is not a problem as we share this policy in our Welcome Packet.

Like most service companies we do utilize computer scheduling.  We offer multiple cleaning packages.  We even offer custom packages.  Cost will vary based on requirements. What we do is complete the clean as defined in the package you purchase.  Most customers prefer to know what they will receive and want it done consistently.

Now let me offer you some feedback as the owner.  I have owned this location since it opened.  We are not perfect but strive to improve every day.  After speaking with multiple members of our team it is clear to me that your goal was to bully your way out of a fee you were fully informed of.  You were extremely abusive and spoke down to all of our team members on the day after Christmas of all days.

While I can empathize with your frustration with being charged a cancellation fee I would challenge to treat people with dignity and respect in the future.  If you cannot do that then I suspect most small business owners like myself would prefer you take your business somewhere else.

Thank you for your feedback.  Have a Happy New Year and if I can ever be of any assistance call the office and ask for Blue.  They will get us in touch.

name: Melissa
text: Kaci, La’Rae, and Jamie were awesome! My apartment has never been so clean! They were very nice, and worked quickly without missing anything! I have never used a cleaning service before, so I really didn’t know what to expect; nevertheless, I was blown away by how well my apartment looked! My kitchen has never looked so spotless! I keep finding things that they cleaned that I wouldn’t have even thought about (i.e. my microwave)! Amazing work with such kind workers! I would highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Melissa for taking the time to let us know that our PHCs did a great job for you!

resp.text: John,  I wanted to reach out regarding your concerns. I have had an opportunity to discuss with team.  First let me say thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We will strive to improve based on the deficiencies you highlighted. Second, let me say I am sorry that you had a bad experience. As our slogan says we strive to be “A Maid Service Worth Talking About”.  This was a situation where we tried to provide service in a situation we probably should not have.  Our team called the office on arrival and quickly noted to management that we would be unable to conform to our standards in the time we estimated based on our phone conversation.  We estimate times based in large part on customer feedback about conditions at the location.   We called you after their arrival in an attempt to reset expectations based on our visual inspection.  Your dissatisfaction confirms that in some cases the service we provide is not the solution.  I feel our team probably knew that on arrival but we tried to be helpful and proceed.  For that we apologize.  Glad to discuss further are your convenience.  Just call the office and ask them to get you in touch with Blue.

name: Abbey Johnson
text:
My mom had hired this company to do a “move out” cleaning of my apartment, the furniture was all moved out and the apartment needed a fairly deep clean before it was inspected. We went back to check everything out almost 4 days after the service came through, and found my thermostat (that I had previously turned off since no one was living there) was running and had been running 24/7 on 65 degrees, and my bedroom fan was still running. So now we will be paying the electric bill for those almost 4 days where my air conditioner had been left to run on a very high setting. Opened the closet with the water heater and there was still dog hair all around the floor, the oven had not been cleaned out, there were flecks of dirt in the bathtub that were not there when I moved out, and nothing around the washer/dryers had been cleaned out. We also went through and re-mopped the floors, and there was dirt coming up on the mopping pads as if the floors had barely been touched. When we sent the photos to the manager, she called my mother back to argue with her that the apartment was very dirty and that they don’t touch water heaters. Apparently sweeping up the floor around the water heater is considered messing with it? This also does not explain the dirty oven, the dirt in the tub that was not there before, and the utilities that had been turned on and left on high for days. All she did was half heartedly offer to come help my mom clean (we had already cleaned up after them so we declined), and no apologies or attempts to reconcile for these other issues were made. She literally only called my mom back to argue with her. $200 later for an hour cleaning of a 450 sq foot apartment, and we had to go spend another hour cleaning up all the stuff they left behind.

If you don’t leave your apartment spotless, which defeats the entire purpose of having a cleaning service come in (I’m not talking leaving it absolutely filthy and covered in trash, but needing reasonable deep cleaning after 2 years of living there), then don’t even bother hiring this service. If you have any complaints or concerns you’ll be argued with and no attempts to reconcile or partially reimburse will be made. Seriously, this service is very overpriced for the service you receive. Hopefully you’ll find better cleaners elsewhere. Very unprofessional.

resp.text:
Abbey your mother did hire Two Maids & a Mop of Auburn.   I am the owner and have had an opportunity to discuss this situation with our team.  Don’t believe you have had any interaction with our team but the space in question is your apartment.

Our team shows up and based on conditions instantly called our manager.

Manager contacted your mother based on condition of apartment on arrival.

It is crucial that we understand the condition of location we will be cleaning so that we price it correctly and adequately schedule time to complete.

Team actually spent an hour over expected time to clean based on conditions they encountered.
.
We received call from your mother on Monday (4 days after clean) with several concerns.

We welcome feedback and as a team look for opportunities to get better each and every day.

Our manager offered to come to the location and walk through it with your Mother and address any missed items.

We value your opinion and thank you for your feedback, but this feedback feels inconsistent with the effort put in by our team cleaning your apartment and that is disappointing.

I will simply close by saying I am glad to have a conversation about this at your convenience.  Feel free to call the office and our team will provide you my contact.   Blue.

name: Amanda McCourry
text: Two Maids was fantastic.   Loved the attention to detail in the cleaning process.  Thanks Kacie and Melissa, you both were awesome!

name: Jonathan
text:
I hired Two Maids & Mop of Auburn for a “deep clean” of my home and did not receive the level of service expected for the price ($345 for less than 1,200 square feet on the lower level of my home).  Quite honestly, it wasn’t even equivalent to what I’d expect from a basic weekly cleaning.  After reporting this to their local office (same day), I was told that refunds or even price adjustments are strictly against franchise policy. My only option was having them revisit my home. The office manager returned with the crew that afternoon for a redo which included an awkward walkthrough.  At times, I actually felt like I had to defend myself for questioning the quality of their work.

Point being, I called this company to help me. I had no issues with paying a premium price, but expected a premium service.

This was such a waste of money and an overall bad experience.  I never even received a follow-up call.  I hope that my review is helpful to those researching cleaning services in Auburn and also to management in possibly reevaluating their policies, pricing, and services.

resp.text:
Johnathan thanks for taking the time to provide our team feedback.  While not what we would like to hear it is through feedback like yours that we can evaluate what we are doing and identify areas for improvement.

Would be glad to discuss your experience at your convenience.  I would be interested to hear about the specific problems you encountered with our clean.

Your satisfaction is our goal.   We are always striving to improve our polices and cleaning processes.  Your rating directly impacts the compensation of our team via our Pay for Performance compensation plan.

Call the office at your convenience and tell them you would like to connect with Blue.

resp.text: Thank you, Diana! We are looking forward to cleaning your home.

name: Pam Brownfield
text: The team showed up right on time and with a great attitude toward the grimy job. When they left, our son's home was cleaner than I've seen it in years. Now he's ready for his new bride to move in! Thank you ladies.

name: Gay Langley
text: They were very nice and did a thorough job.

name: Tracy Snoddy
text: These ladies know how to clean! Great job

name: Dalton Dunlap
text: Absolutely amazing! Wonderful job!

name: Susan Harris
text: Very thorough and polite!

name: Laura Faith
text: Great cleaning service!!

name: Motki Didi
text: Very expensive

resp.text:
Motki,  Perhaps you should try the service before calling it expensive.  While I am sure you are an excellent judge of residential house cleaning services  what made you deem our service expensive when we have not actually done a cleaning for you?

In the end I would consider Motki's review for what it is.  The opinion of someone who has not used our service.  Driving up their guide level by simply giving reviews on any business they land I suppose.

name: Dorothy Curtis
text: Thank you Team 3 - Donna, Angie and Kelly.  You were prompt, professional and worked very efficiently.  You worked around the boxes and chaos of moving in with smiles and encouraging words.  I would like you to come monthly to help us maintain.  Many thanks!

name: Matt Hallman
text: Had CJ pressure wash our home after we bought it. It hadn’t been cleaned in years. It now looks as good as it did when it was new. Our exterior is completely vinyl siding. They were done in a couple hours. Would have taken me days. Hiring them was well worth it, and I’ll be calling again when it’s time.

name: rebeccawcleung
text: CJ and his team is extremely friendly and responded very quickly to my request for a quote. The price is fair and they promised to come within the same week. They worked professionally and helped to clean my gutter and windows and did a thorough job pressure washing the driveway and the exterior. He also showed me that a part of my roof needs repair and took pictures to show me. He even offered to put in a few screws to fix my gutter which is coming loose! They went above and beyond and I am so impressed. CJ even helped me to change my exterior lightbulb because I didn't have a long ladder! I will definitely use them again and highly recommend to anyone.

name: THE ACOUSTIC CAGE
text:
Contacted him december 5th...told me he'd get back with me...december 22nd, he texts to say "aint forgot you", then forgot me...now its jan 11th....these guys dont need business...they have too much apparently...i'll just get rags, windex, and do it myself.
So much easier this way....

Reply: this is the only way i can find to reply to you, CJ...im greg nelson.

resp.text: Who are you? I don't recall speaking with you.

name: Alison Hudnall
text: CJ is an extremely friendly, easy-going guy. He was respectful and attentive and did a quality job for us - even when I kept adding more and more windows that I wanted him to clean! I am proud to recommend him and his company!

resp.text: Thank you Alison!

name: Anica Marx
text: Carl was an amazing help. He did an outstanding job at cleaning our windows. He is super kind and professional. Got the quote right on the day I called and he came over the next day. I can highly recommend Carl.

resp.text: Thank you so much! It was a pleasure meeting you and working with you. I hope to continue.

name: barbara hanby
text:
The service was excellent and served with a smile!
Will definitely use them again! Plan to try pressure washing next!

resp.text: Thank you! We will be more than happy to serve you again.

name: Joe Ware
text: Great job pressure washing my house.

name: S. K.
text: I messaged CJ’s on Saturday, had an estimate back from them ASAP: it’s only Thursday and terrible weather for a partially exterior project, and the job is complete already. My windows had dirt, bugs, and cobwebs all over them. They were streaked on the exterior. Now they look brand new, like newly installed. (CJ’s cleaned the interiors of my windows too.) Plus, they pressure washed my badly stained and mildewed walkways and patios making them look like newly poured concrete. From start to finish they were three words — PROFESSIONAL, REASONABLE, and THOROUGH. I have very high expectations for services such as these, and I couldn’t be more pleased. Thank you, CJ’s!

resp.text: Aww thank you Mrs. Kilgore. It was a pleasure doing business with you!

name: Bob Wilson
text: Very pleased with the professionalism, promptness, thoroughness, respectfulness, and friendliness of the owner and staff of CJ's

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Wilson! We look forward to serving you for years to come.

name: Juana Gutierrez
text: I was almost mowed down by an employee. Their blatant disregard for the rules of operating a motor vehicle is sickening. He was on his phone speeding and used no blinker in a construction zone on the interstate and had the audacity to shoot me the bird when I honked to let him know I was on the road. Ridiculous and rude.

resp.text:
Good evening Juana, I want to apologize for the incident earlier. I felt bad for making that Mistake and almost causing an accident. I told my employees I know I scared whoever was in the vehicle and I actually said sorry and threw my hand up (even though you couldn't see me or hear me). I have children too, so I know the feeling even if it wasn't children involved everyone's life is precious and
valuable. I'm sorry for that.  I wasn't on the phone nor was I speeding I was coming on to the highway off the bypass my lane was running out I was near the end a truck had moved over, so I started to move over as well to get on to the highway and you were in my blind spot I didn't see you. I am not a reckless driver nor would I ever risk lives intentionally, i didn't see you in my blind spot I looked twice and was seeing my lane running out, so when the truck moved over to let me in that's when I proceeded to move over not knowing you were back there. I'm happy everyone was and is safe. I do understand your frustration, I would've been to and have been in that situation before. However, I do truly feel you can forgive me for a mistake like I forgave them.

name: Chancee Terry
text: Carl came out and got the job done! house looks brand-new the doors almost blinded us when we looked at him we will definitely use them again!!

name: kqren thomas
text: They are very promt and professional  with attention to all the little details!!! He did such a great job I set up monthly cleanings!!!

name: lynnette johnson
text: The service was very professional and reasonable. I would highly recommend them for any pressure washing needs.

resp.text: Thank you so very much appreciated :)

name: SWEET ANNIE
text: Quick and reasonable !

name: Marlin Harris
text: Good service

name: Jimbo Marx
text: cant remember the recruiter i spoke with but she was not very friendly out of the Birmingham branch, her name was maybe Maggie or Maddie? anyway i cant remember. Anyway not a good look when you are trying to hire cleaning talent like mine

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out. We’re sorry you had an unpleasant experience and we’d like to get more information. Please send us an email at voice@diversifiedm.com and someone from our team will be in touch.

name: Kevin Hollingsworth
text: Very friendly and professional. I might add understanding.

name: Bernard Smith
text: Not good @ payroll time schedule for some employees.?

name: Stephanie Reynolds
text: Don’t work for them because you sure won’t get your first pay!!!

resp.text: We’re sorry you had an unpleasant experience and we’d like to get more information. Please send us an email at voice@diversifiedm.com and someone from our team will be in touch.

name: Mr Smith
text: Spoke with a madeline she was super rude

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out. We’re sorry you had an unpleasant experience and we’d like to get more information. Please send us an email at voice@diversifiedm.com and someone from our team will be in touch.

name: geri keefe
text: The girls did a very good job.

name: Candace Shoaff
text:
Cleaning and More overcharged my debit card by $400 for a uhaul rental.  I called Monday morning as soon as they opened and they told me it was their mistake they would reverse it.   I didn't call again until Thursday as I was trying to be patient.  Thursday my account was overdrawn and they told me they couldn't do anything about it to call Uhaul.   If I had a business and my mistake had caused someone the problems this has caused me I would have figured out how to get that person their money back.  Not take their money and then say my hands are tied.
Very unprofessional, horrible customer service.  Most definitely do not do business here if you can avoid it.

name: Rachel Dawsey
text: Cleaning and more has been cleaning for our business for years.  They are very reliable.  If we ever have any problems, the owners are quick to correct.  It is very convenient to order supplies from the Hope Janitorial supply so that the Cleaning and More staff deliver them.  You get a discount on supplies if they clean for you.

resp.text: Cleaning & More appreciates you taking the time to comment on your service.  It has been a pleasure serving your company for the past six years and look forward to many more.  It is Cleaning & More's hope all our customers see us as a long term relationship by serving them with reliability and dependability. Thank you again!

name: Marie Porter
text: We have used Cleaning and More for over 10 years and have always been satisfied with their work. If anything was ever missed, Donna had someone correct it quickly without hesitation. They have even checked on our cat for us, when we were on vacation. I would highly recommend Cleaning and More!

name: Lailoni Hill
text: You will never get what you pay for nor will you get paid for your efforts work wise. Unfortunately the owners are greedy and unworthy of their hard working employees and overcharged customers. Bless em'.

resp.text: We apologize you feel you were not fairly paid.  At Cleaning And More we have always made it a practice to pay above the federal minimum wage set by the Fair Labor Standards Act.  We are hard working people which has made us a strong and long lasting company.

name: De Anne Snow
text: Great place for all janitorial and restaurant supplies

name: Felicia Cruce
text: To much drama for a place to work need better communication and team leaders certain ones don't like training new people and always complain about it if you don't like your job and need to change do not recommend working here

resp.text: Felicia, We at Cleaning & More wish you would have communicated your concerns about leadership before walking out mid-shift.  It is our hope you are able to get along with new co-workers at future employments.

name: Jessup Gentry
text: I worked there it is a backwoods cleaning company I worked there for 4 years ......they cut corners they lie ......if the day manager doesn't like you she will talk about you send false reports out to county services ...my advice don't look for employment there much less for them to cater of clean it's a failing company and I was told it was a great Christian place that was a Lie!!!!

resp.text: Jessup, it sounds as if you were upset when you wrote this.  You know the employees of Cleaning & More follow principled standards of professionalism and strong work ethics, which helps us to maintain strong relationships with our employees and customers.  We believe this type of work ethic is what prompted you to seek employment with us twice.

name: Lance Phillips
text: Terrible cleaning service! Huge thumbs down!

resp.text: Sorry you feel this way, Mr. Phillips.  It is our goal to build long term relationships with our customers.  This is the reason Cleaning & More has been in business for twenty-seven years.  Let me express our experience in business in a quote by John Lydgate: "You can please some of the people all the time, you can please all of the people some of the time, but you can't please all of the people all of the time."

name: Kim Speegle
text: Lied about hiring

name: Timothy Mckinley
text: Very responsive and always a great job. They listen to your concerns and do everything possible to make sure they clean your home right the first time. We have been using them for 8+months and they haven't disappointed yet

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Ann Vann
text:
Walls2Walls Cleaning service has been cleaning my home for 2+ years now. I like that they use nontoxic cleaners that are safe around my baby.
The owner, Sasha Walls, is very responsive to requests and consistent with communication.
The ladies who have been cleaning recently- Serena, Alicia, and Tabitha- are very thorough. They clean, scrub, and dust the places that I would normally never get to! They have been very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much Ann. We appreciate your business!

name: Brandi Hesseltine
text: Highly recommend Walls2Walls for residential cleaning services. They are polite and professional, timely, and pay attention to the details in our home. They have done an outstanding job in our home, and have been very patient in working around my family of 5 since we are all home right now working and doing schoolwork.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Paul Martin
text: The staff is excellent and professional.  I have used the service weekly for over a year and never had a complaint. At times I asked staffers for minor requests which were taken into account. Recommendations to other friends and businesses are always a yes. You could not ask for a better cleaning service.

resp.text: Thank you Paul! We appreciate your business!

name: Naomi Ramont
text: Tabitha and Alicia were excellent! This was the first time I've had someone else clean my house and actually cleaned houses for years. They were quick, efficient, friendly, and did a great job! Thank you so much, ladies!!!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Thomas Clingerman
text: I’ve been using Walls 2 Walls for over 4 years now. Very respectful and always addresses any issues that I might have. Thank you!  Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you so much Thomas!

name: Franklin Chrisman
text: They never called me back.

resp.text: I'm so sorry we dropped the ball on your call. I truly don't remember you ever calling. Could we have been closed? Thank you for your response we will definitely use it as constructive criticism and use it to do bettet!

name: Sarah Cholevik
text: Tabitha and her team are amazing! They always do a great job of making sure things are just right!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much!! We appreciate your business!

name: Sammie Anderson
text: I work here as Sasha Walls personal assistant and I absolutely love it. You can really tell that Sasha and her cleaners really care about their clients and the quality of their work. The cleaners are also very friendly and honest people just like Sasha! I highly recommend them!!

name: Kim Holladay
text: My in-laws’ house was vacant for two years. Walls2Walls made the interior look new. Highly recommend!!

name: Valessa Carr
text: Wonderful employer!

name: Clndy Dunn
text: Awesome company!

name: Rab Stewart
text: Tom and the people at Specialty Cleaning can handle your mess. They will shoot you straight and get to work!

name: Amy Patton
text: You won’t find a more honest, reliable and trustworthy company to clean your home. They have done residential and commercial cleaning and are always professional and on time!!

name: Charles McClellan
text: Very honest and reliable people who do excellent work!!

name: Jeremy Patton
text: Tom is a wonderful person to work with.

name: Adam Farley
text: We use Jani-king of Montgomery as our cleaning service twice a week. They do a great job! Call them and ask for Cory to handle your account because the man cares about his customers, he communicates well with us and is a very hard worker himself. He recently came out and stripped, cleaned and waxed our floors. I was worried about some areas because we did some rearranging and the floor in those areas were in horrible condition. Cory made sure that floor looked brand new before he left. Thanks again for your hard work and attention to detail.

name: Amanda Boles
text: I applied for a position that fit my schedule perfectly via Facebook.  Last Thursday Nadia Mathieu contacted me and we agreed on an interview date and time.  Monday August 31 at 8 am.  I have another job that started at 9, however I was honest with Nadia about that.  I arrived at the office Monday morning at 745.  I waited until 750 and went to the door.  I rang the bell.  Older lady came to the door and I informed her I was there to interview with Nadia at 8.  She then informed me Nadia would not arrive at work until 9 due to unknown reasons.  I was shocked.  I understand things happen.  So ok I left a message with the lady to ask Nadia to call me.  I waited most of the day on her call.  I emailed her that afternoon.  I expressed my continued interest in the position and asked could we schedule another interview.  Now Thursday I didn't receive any response from Nadia.  I received email today from Office Pride stating I didn't met the requirements from r the position I applied for and they decided to go in a different direction.  Wow seriously!  How is that possible when I didn't even interview.  At this point, I'm furious they would decline me for a position I know I'm qualified for.  So I called the office and spoke to Nadia.  She apologized for her not showing up.  I asked her why she couldn't communicate with me after she arrived at the office and realized she missed the interview.  This company is awful and I would never work for them.  They declined to consider me for the position due to her missing the interview.

resp.text: Amanda, you couldn’t have known this but Nadia had a car accident while traveling to work that morning.  You were excluded from consideration because of the way you conducted yourself when you were tragically inconvenienced.  That was more effective than any interview we could have done. Thanks for your consideration

name: Chica Llorona
text: We are new to the area, and Office Pride helped my sister who is hearing impaired (deaf). They worked with her and the Recruiter Andrea even conducted the interview by writing back and forth with my sister. it shows just how compassionate they are In helpinh people succeed. Thank you very much.

resp.text: Chica thank you for your review.  Our mission is to honor God by positively impacting people and workplaces. I am so glad we could be a positive impact for your sister.  We are very glad to have her as part of our team.  Thank you!

name: Dustin George
text: Office Pride has been so great to work with. From the initial estimate, to scheduling, to all of the work being done, they have truly been a pleasure to work with. The employees were very nice and professional. I have zero complaints and would highly recommend them to any business.

resp.text: Dustin, I am pleased your experience was very positive.  Thank you and thanks for the recommendation

name: Cadence Davis
text: Office Pride is the worst janitorial place to work for! I kept the office that I was assigned to neat and tidy, but I still felt unappreciated and unvalued. I worked for a dialysis clinic called Fresenius for 3 months and the RN manager named Wendy always called and complained to Office Pride and I’m not saying she’s wrong for complaining but at that point I felt like she didn’t want me there so she found any reason to tell them to get rid of me but they ended up to replacing me and tried to  put me somewhere else so i decided to resign from the company instead. Office Pride is the company that will take the company’s side before they take will the employee side that works for them. For example, Fresenius will call the office and complain and get upset, but if I call and complain about them not having supplies they will not do anything. Also, Office Pride is very lazy when it comes to bringing supplies to each account. Of course, I made mistakes but I took full accountability for it and did my best to fix it. We all can’t please everyone and everyone will not like you. Office Pride you’re suppose to be a “Christian” environment but is totally the opposite. No, I’m not bashing the company I’m just giving my honest opinion. Hate it or Love it.

name: Larry Vaughan
text: Top notch people, top notch service.

name: Willie Tucker
text: My experience with Office Pride in Madison started around 4 years ago.  A representative visited my office and initially I was reluctant to listen as I didn't want the added expense of a cleaning service.  This was something that I had been taking care of for my office for a few years.  After consideration, I decided to use Office Pride for my janitorial service to take the burden off of me.  After a few years, I was approached by a friend to provide the same services at the same price I was paying with Office Pride so I switched.  Bad mistake.  After about 6 months, I ended up calling Kathy and signing back up with Office Pride.  I'll never make that mistake again.  Office Pride does a very thorough job and I never have to worry about cleaning my office myself anymore.  They send out a representative at least once per month to make sure that I am satisfied with the job that they are doing as well as doing their own visual inspection.  Very satisfied client!

name: Lita Alford
text:
We are a small company in Huntsville, AL comprised mostly of male workers.  After several BAD experiences personally and business wise with janitorial/cleaning services, I was extremely sensitive to cost, honesty, expectations, workability, and work ethics.
After mentioning the condition of the bathroom floors to our cleaning lady, on a few occasions – sticky, dirty looking, etc., she up and quit.  I started cleaning our office suite – approx. 1800 sq. ft. with 3 bathrooms.  All the while, I was looking for “that perfect cleaning company” that would not cost the company a small fortune.
Sitting at a Taco Bell eating lunch in my car, I looked up and saw a car with “Office Pride Commercial Cleaning” sign on the door.  And the rest, as they say, is history.  I left a voice mail message; received a prompt reply to set up a site visit.  Lee Weeks came to our office with a professional demeanor, marketing folder filled with any information I could ask for; a sincere desire to meet my expectations (which are extremely high) and our company’s budget.
Their first cleaning to “bring our office up to their standards” was phenomenal.  I appreciate the fact they use color coded cloths for specific areas; leave their vacuum cleaner here (not transferring dust/dirt from other offices), and provide cleaning supplies.  Cathy (operations manager) is great – always accommodating and understanding that we are the customer.
Cathy, Lee, Patricia, Leigh Ann, Susie + others strive to meet and exceed our company’s janitorial requirements.  I appreciate their desire to meet our expectations, their dependability, work ethics, and overall attitude.  It is so refreshing in this day and age to experience outside entities that do what they say they will do!

name: Janet L Hunter
text: Nice,  Professional, Christian Company

name: Rhodia Chaplin
text: As a facility manager, I must ensure that every vendor that I select provide professionalism, honesty, integrity, and commitment to doing what's right.  For the type of business we operate individuals must be scrutinzed through security before they can enter the facility.  When I first interviewed with Troy Hopkins it was a spiritual connection when he stated that his company put God 1st.  Not do they put God 1st, but they also do a background check on their employees. Knowing this gave me assurance & a peace of mind in the services they would render for my company.  After we walked through the entire office, I received a packet of information explaining everything that was discussed during the walk thru.  I went from a previous vendor providing 5-8 employees to clean our building to one individual when I switched over to Office Pride. The work performed Monday - Friday was exceptional.  Not only was our building spotless, but this one individual also maintained our cleaning supplies inventory. There was never too much or too little stock.  Once a month a supervisor would come out to do a white glove inspection of the work that was being done by their employee. The price is right for impeccable service provided.  Awesome staff to work with!

name: J Mc
text: I have been using Office Pride since nearly the day that they started in Huntsville, and have continued to utilize them for their commercial cleaning services through a variety of employers / businesses and office spaces; My good experiences with them go back more than 10 years, and I will certainly say that I am totally satisfied with the work that they do. Our office space is clean, well-kept, and organized, and in the Architecture-Engineering-Planning business, the office space presentation that we put forth is incredibly important - or clients can tell by the presentation of our own space how we will treat and value their space. Office Pride is an integral element of our program, and I would surely recommend their services to anyone in the market.

name: Brittany McCowan
text:
I wouldn’t trust anyone besides Office Pride for our janitorial needs.

Our janitor, Pam, is an absolute gem and is willing to go the extra mile. She got on her hands and knees to clean our hardwood stairs when there were spills. She is always on the lookout for anything amiss (i.e. loose banister, water pressure issues, supplies shortage, etc.) and promptly alerts our staff. Plus, Pam leaves the nicest notes to start our work week.

A big thank you to Pam and the Office Pride team in Madison!

name: Amy Guerin
text:
Our company has been in the Huntsville area for over 20 years and have used several of the local cleaning services before switching to Office Pride.  We have been using Office Pride for over eight years and have always received excellent service and support throughout that time.  The staff at Office Pride are always professional, courteous and willing to accommodate our janitorial needs in a timely manner.

Because they are committed to providing excellent service, the Office Pride Team conduct a monthly inspection (walk-through) of our facility in order to stay on top of our cleaning requirements.  During this inspection, they meet with the staff to discuss any issues we may be having or areas that may need improvement.  I am happy to say we never have any to report because their staff always do a thorough job.

I would highly recommend them for all your cleaning needs.  You can be confident that your business and facility will be well taken care of and in good hands with a professional cleaning staff.   Office Pride will strive to meet or exceed your janitorial service needs.

name: Queen Isaac
text: Only hire Hispanics and Whites (BLACK Females not welcomed)... RUDE & unprofessional Andrea is not qualified just as she wasn't for Automation at LG ELECTRONICS. This company doesn't deserve not even  one🌟.

resp.text: Ashley (Queen), I wanted to reach out and respectfully ask you be fair and professional when leaving reviews.  You know we have actually offered you several positions you turned down.  I recommend being more flexible with your availability and/or the tasks you are willing to perform. If you knew anything about our workforce, you wouldn't make such inaccurate claims. I see you have a history of leaving one star reviews for other businesses. Maybe try a more positive approach?  All the best in your future endeavors.

name: Rush Dickson
text:
"I wanted to take the time to give my two-cents worth about Office Pride. Their employees are efficient, polite and on time. My tenants always comment that they know when Office Pride has been there to clean as they leave such a clean smell behind. I am a project manager, located in Virginia Beach, VA and as such, it is a great feeling knowing I do not have to worry that the work is not being done to my satisfaction. I recently needed special light bulbs for the restrooms and Office Pride took it upon themselves to go purchase the bulbs for me which is not in their job duties. It is great to have a company go that extra mile!"

--Melaney Cubilla, Carothers Park

name: Jamie Turgeon
text: I first became aware of Office Pride a few years ago when the president and CEO, Troy Hopkins, walked into our small office building. He is a very personable man and after briefly explaining what his company offers; he left me with some brochures to read over. At the time, we were unsatisfied with the current janitorial service we had and when he followed back up, it was clear that it was time to make a move. It didn’t hurt that we were getting more bang for the buck - Office Pride’s prices were lower and they would be coming more often.  Another bonus is that each month an inspection is performed. Office Pride sends over one of their reps to come in and check over our facility to double check the quality of cleaning. Any time I have ever had to call Office Pride for anything, they are very responsive.  In addition, they have a customer appreciation luncheon each year which is a very nice perk. We are very satisfied with their service and would recommend them to any company looking for a top notch janitorial service in the Huntsville area.

name: Lisa Garland Segroves
text:
Office Pride Stands Out From Other Commercial Cleaning Services

Our office spent several years trying to motivate and survive several corporate cleaning services before finding the attentive, professional couple who cleaned for our company. When they told us they were moving to another state, the thought of going back to sub-par service, and valuable time spent each week going over what needed to be cleaned was depressing. Working for a company that supports sustainability and "green" practices, I started the search by looking for green cleaning companies in the Huntsville AL area, and Office Pride was at the top of the results list. After reading the Core Beliefs statement on Office Pride's website and meeting with the Huntsville office manager, we decided to give them an opportunity to show us the difference between Office Pride and other corporate services, and we are truly pleased with the results. We have received consistent, responsive, quality service from Office Pride of Huntsville at a very fair price. Office Pride's carpet cleaning service rescued us with top-notch, professional service at Christmas with a last minute carpet cleaning two days before our annual open house, securing a place in our annual Christmas prep for many years to come. Because of the quality of service we have received in our Huntsville office, we contacted Office Pride of Nashville when the time came to hire a service for our new branch office. We are grateful for the weekly service we receive from Office Pride and look forward to many years of partnership.

name: Jennie Collier
text: Have not heard back

name: Angel Wilson
text: Very helpful

name: Angelina Blair
text: Very rude staff bad customer service

resp.text: Angelina,  I am sorry you have had a less than satisfactory experience with Office Pride.  I have done some research and cannot ascertain who you are or what company you represent. Would you kindly provide me those details and more specifics about your experience?

name: Mrs Tuck
text: I’ve used this cleaning company more than once! Anyone can do a great job the first time but to continually do a great job and be professional is very rare in the time we’re living in! I can honestly say that I’m truly grateful for this company. They left my building smelling like lemons it lasted up to 3 weeks!! They arrived within the appointed time frame and really gave me a fresh perspective on using cleaning companies! I have to say that I was pleased from booking to seeing the results of the work! Thank you for your professionalism and a job well done!

name: tor zaleski
text: I paid $285 for a "deep clean" so that my wife could relax and start off the new year less stressed. We selected for the baseboards and doors to be cleaned. Keep in mind, our house was so clean when the two cleaners arrived they even commented on this. Here is a photo of just one of the baseboards in our master bathroom and the magic eraser after my wife cleaned it herself. Not only did my wife have to do the cleaning herself, which is what I was trying to avoid, but now she is upset about having wasted so much money on something to be done poorly. Will not use again, nor will I recommend.

resp.text:
Mr Zaleski, We want to thank you for allowing us to rectify our error! We are thrilled you are satisfied with our service and our team looks forward to servicing you again in the near future! ECC strives to deliver the best possible experience to all of our customers. Expeditious, courteous, professional, detailed service is our goal for every customer, every single time. Guaranteed!
Best regards,
Mrs. Burden
334-246-2230

name: Shemeka Brock
text: I booked Expert Cleaning Concepts for a messy closet makeover and to organize my cabinets. In the 3 hours that they were at my home. They cleaned my entire apartment and left it spotless. The workers were friendly and very attentive.

name: Hayden J

We have had to go to Sam's and Dollar General numerous times recently to get essential supplies that we've paid Cintas for and they have consistently not delivered. The one business we have left doesn't need anywhere close to the amount of stuff we originally signed up for, but apparently the fact that the main business doesn't exist anymore doesn't matter to Cintas.
